title: What are the benefits of having a daily journal? Does it help to express and write about your feelings in a journal? - Quora

response.answer_text: Yes, it definitely does help to express your feelings. Even more: it helps you to understand what’s going on with you in the first place. I discovered the power of journaling by accident when I was 16, after my first heartbreak. I was just drawing some lines and scribbling random words. At some point, my hand just started to write questions like “Why does it hurt so much?” And without answering them, I felt a short relieve. So I continued, or better to say: let my hand continue. And it felt great! So I started a journal. Now, some twenty years later, I am still doing it. Though I don’t use it daily — except for times of turmoil, when things are changing or big things are happening. However, I realized that when I don’t write at least once a week, I start to feel worse, somehow detached from myself. So I try to not skip for long, and write not only when I feel bad, but also when I feel great. :) Journaling is a powerful way of self-discovery, and I can’t imagine who I would be without my journals…
